Unfortunately, the feeling I got was akin to interrupting a brain surgeon at work—although this one was operating on cardboard with a box cutter. Brusque and utterly uninterested, the employee barely looked up, offering only a curt, unhelpful suggestion before returning to their task. There was zero effort to understand my needs or my colleague's preferences. This once reliable establishment, usually a beacon of knowledgeable service, truly disappointed me. While the selection remains impressive, the lack of customer care was stark. I ended up picking a bottle at random, feeling unwelcome. My next purchase will likely be elsewhere.

I read some blog about a guy going off as to how great this place was. So my wife and I drove to Brossard to check it out.

The restaurant is laid out very unusually, its half a bar, pizza place and the other half is the breakfast side. When you first arrive we thought we entered the wrong place, because it was a pizza joint with no server present. Once we walked through the pizza place we entered the side of the breakfast place where some random waiter said "ya just sit anywhere". The food was so-so, nothing to write home about really. I had the eggs Benedict, and while edible, the hollandaise was a bit bland and the potatoes seemed like an afterthought. My wife's omelette was similarly unremarkable. The atmosphere felt a bit disjointed, and the initial confusion certainly didn't help set a positive tone. Given the drive and the underwhelming experience, I'm not sure we'll be making a return trip. It certainly didn't live up to the blog's hype.

One of the few places that was open for Christmas and what a unexpected present! My bar manager at Fez used to manage for the this restaraunt and suggested we all go in a group. Now, pulling into this place it looked like it would be some hole in the wall restaraunt. It was all black on the outside, so you couldn't see in and it was in a strip mall!! But let me tell ya, when you walk in there is an immediate change of heart as soon as you see the fountain waterfall in front of you.

It was like stepping into an elegant, inviting oasis! The interior was beautifully decorated and warm. Despite it being Christmas Day, the service was impeccable and genuinely friendly. Every dish we ordered was simply delicious and beautifully presented. My steak was perfectly cooked, and my friends raved about their pasta. This place turned a potentially tough holiday meal into a delightful, memorable experience. A true hidden gem – highly recommend!

The food was fresh, well prepared and delicious. The service was friendly and attentive. Not a fan of the ambiance, but I'm not there to eat the decor.

I went on a Saturday night around 6pm it was busy but not packed. I had samosas and they were freshly made, crispy on the outside and tender inside with a little spice. I tried the szechuan chicken, basically fried chicken pieces with onion, green peppers and hot peppers which again were freshly made, crispy outside and tender inside.

I was looking for a quick and satisfying meal, and this place absolutely delivered. The portions were generous, especially for the price point, making it excellent value. Despite my reservations about the rather dated decor, the quality of the cuisine truly shone through. I left feeling completely satisfied and impressed by the vibrant flavors and the genuine warmth of the staff. This spot is definitely a hidden gem for anyone craving authentic and delicious Indian/Chinese fusion.

The first time I came here, I recognized the lady working the counter was the lady who worked at Jenni Pho. I can't comment on the pho as my favorite dish is the dried vermicelli salad. I also ordered their 3-bean dessert. It was a good first experience which deemed for a second trip.

My second visit was not as good. Because It was a work day, I decided to use the drive through, however when I got to the drive through there was a sign that said "come inside to see the menu." This was quite inconvenient, especially when trying to save time on a lunch break. I went inside and ordered my usual dried vermicelli salad. While the food was still decent, it didn't have the same fresh, vibrant taste as my first visit, and the portion felt slightly smaller. The 3-bean dessert remained a highlight, but the initial hassle and the slight dip in food quality made the experience less enjoyable overall. I'm torn on whether to give them another shot, but if I do, I'll definitely skip the drive-through and dine in.

I used to love coming to Mimi's when I would be in town visiting family. It used to be crowded and we'd have to rush to beat the line. Sadly those times are done....I will not be back!

When we got there at 6pm the place was empty. Score!?! No, its empty because it has majority gone down hill. We had 4 people and split 2 dinner for 2s and we got the baked brie also. Regarding our 5 appetizers: baked brie bleh (better not melted and not enough bread), house **salads were limp and drowned in dressing. The French Onion soups, usually a highlight, were watery and lacked flavor – just sad. Then came the main courses from our 'dinner for 2s.' The chicken was dry, and the pasta dishes tasted like they'd been reheated multiple times. Everything felt tired, from the food to the service which was slow despite the emptiness. It's truly heartbreaking to see a beloved spot fall so far. Save your money and memories; this isn't the Mimi's you remember.**

I went here with the high hopes that it will be my new favorite place since there are great positive reviews about it.. sadly, my hopes were all shattered :(

Service: If I could give a negative star, I would. We were seated right away at the bar, but then, it has been 10 minutes at least, and no one had taken the initiative to give us a menu or offer a drink. My boyfriend ended up getting a menu himself up front. After that, still nothing. So I asked the chef on the bar (I think he's the owner) if someone could please assist us. He barely made eye contact, just shrugged, and motioned dismissively towards a server who was busy chatting at the other end of the bar. We felt completely ignored and, honestly, quite unwelcome. After another five minutes of being invisible, we decided enough was enough. We simply got up and left without ever placing an order. It's truly disappointing when a place fails so spectacularly on basic hospitality. We never even got a chance to try the food, and I certainly won't be back.

This place is a F N joke!!! I took my car to the Henderson shop for a routine oil change, expecting professional service. Instead, I got pure incompetence. My car has a plastic undercarriage cover that needs to be removed to access the oil filter. Not only did their 'mechanic' remove it, but they clearly couldn't be bothered to put it back on. Finding that missing was infuriating and completely unacceptable.

As if that wasn't bad enough, they tried to upsell me on an air filter, claiming mine needed to be replaced. Funny, considering I just installed a brand new one myself last week! It's insulting to be treated like I know nothing about my own vehicle. Then there's the 'synthetic blend oil' claim. Yeah, right. After these issues, I have zero trust in anything they say.

DO NOT TAKE YOUR CAR THERE!!!! This was an absolute nightmare. I should have known better. I will never again take my car to this establishment, and I urge everyone to stay far, far away. Save yourself the headache and potential damage to your vehicle.

I ate here last week. I initially enjoyed the ambiance, the nice wait staff, and the wide selection of sushi, robata, and cocktails. However, our food and drinks were littered with inedible garnishes. One of our drinks contained inedible wood sticks and leaves, while the plate came with a side of hollowed out crustacean appendages.

While I understand that the harvested tree parts add to the flavor of the drink, the crustacean carcases added nothing to the plate other than to disgust their customers. It was an incredibly off-putting experience. While I appreciate creativity in presentation, there's a fine line between artistic flair and just plain gross. Serving what looked like discarded crab shells next to our beautifully prepared sushi made us question the hygiene and intent. It completely overshadowed any positive aspects of the meal. We left feeling more bewildered than satisfied, and definitely won't be returning. A shame, as the potential is there, but the execution needs a serious re-think.

I had mentioned to my boyfriend that I needed to renew my eyeglass prescription, and he mentioned the deal America's best had where you can get an eye exam and 2 pairs of glasses including the lenses for $69.99. I needed contacts as well and when I called the store, I specifically asked if there was a way to get both the eyeglass and contact lens exam for an additional cost. The woman on the phone told me for $79.99 I could have both the eyeglass exam and contact lens exam, so just $10 more.

I was genuinely impressed by this incredible value! Booking the appointment was straightforward, and when I arrived, the staff was welcoming and efficient. Dr. Smith (or generic pleasant doctor) was thorough with both exams, clearly explaining everything and answering all my questions. There was no pressure to upgrade or add unnecessary extras. Picking out frames was easy with their wide selection, and ordering my contacts was a breeze. For the price, the service and quality truly exceeded my expectations. America's Best really lives up to its name for affordability and great care. I highly recommend them!

We dined here this evening with my daugher's dance studio being located in the same plaza. We were both super excited to get a Greek place nearby and had waited anxiously since we saw the signage up prior to opening. It was pretty disappointing, I am sad to say :(\n\nWe had to wait about 5 minutes at the counter to place our order and finally, I think one of the owners, came over to assist us in our order. We waited almost 40 minutes for one gyro plate and one souvlaki plate although they did bring out soup samples. While the gesture was kind, it didn't make up for the extensive delay. When our food finally arrived, the gyro meat was dry and the fries were cold. My daughter's souvlaki was bland and lacked vibrant Greek flavors. The portions felt small for the price too. Overall, the long wait combined with the subpar food made for a truly underwhelming experience. We had such high hopes, but unfortunately, we won't be rushing back.

I was in Las Vegas a couple of weeks ago for work. On Friday night we went out for a group dinner at Enoteca. I have never been to this establishment but having been to Carnevino and having a WONDERFUL dinner I had expectations.

Enoteca is a bit more casual and low key than Carne and offers pastas, pizzas and a small variety of entrees.

Our group started with a selection of cheeses, Prosciutto di Parma and fried squash blossoms. Not being a huge fan of fried squash blossoms, I was pleasantly surprised by their delicate flavor. The cheese and prosciutto were excellent. For my main, I chose the Tagliatelle Bolognese, which was perfectly rich and satisfying. My colleagues also enjoyed their various pizzas and the Branzino. Enoteca, while certainly more casual than Carnevino, offers an equally authentic and delicious Italian experience. The service was attentive, and the ambiance inviting. It's a fantastic spot for a relaxed group dinner, offering wonderful food without the formality.

OWNERS - STAY AWAY FROM THEM!!!!!!!!
Read the other reviews. They are all true. This company could care less about you and your tenants. I won't even go into my long list of problems because they have an excuse to justify everything they do. Seriously, look at how much time the owner spends responding to complaints on this site. He doesn't know how to say "I am sorry, I did not service your account correctly, let me fix it." Instead, he puts 100% of his effort into laying blame at everyone else's feet. It's utterly exhausting. My experience has been a constant battle against their incompetence and complete lack of accountability. Every issue is met with a defensive counter-argument rather than a solution. They are not interested in resolving problems; they are only interested in avoiding responsibility. Save yourself the headache, frustration, and financial strain. Find a management company that actually values its clients and tenants, and is willing to admit when they've messed up. This isn't it.

Shocker folks, I don't normally like hot dogs. The only way you can hand me a hot dog I'll actually eat is if it's fresh off the grill. With loads of ketchup...and I DO mean loads, like buckets full! If I ever think of eating a hot dog without ketchup, the world may end. The world kinda did tonight...a little.

I ordered the New York Dog and the Sweetbread Dog, plus the duck fat fries to split with my friend. I had to order the NYC Dog because I love me some sauerkraut and a good snap. It was great, but the Sweetbread Dog... that was the shocker. I took a bite, then another, then another. No ketchup. Not a single squirt! The rich, savory sweetness of the sweetbread, combined with the perfectly grilled dog, was so unexpectedly incredible that I didn't want to drown it. My world didn't end; it just got a whole lot more delicious. Oh, and the duck fat fries? Crispy perfection. This place is a revelation!

If I could post zero stars, that's what I would do. Let me preface this with the fact that we got here at 7pm on a Saturday...busy time for sure, but a restaurant should be able to forecast for that. After placing our orders, our waiter let's me know that I got the last order of brisket available (again, it's only 7pm on a saturday). Next, our food comes and here's where the real fun starts. My Mom's pulled pork looks chopped (as opposed to actually pulled) and it's DRY AS a desert. Truly inedible. My 'last order' of brisket was tough, flavorless, swimming in bland sauce. My brother's ribs were overcooked mush, and dad's chicken was rubbery. Our overwhelmed waiter offered no solutions, just a weak offer to replace food we had no faith in. Even the sides were dismal. This was a complete Saturday night disaster. Save your money and go elsewhere. We left utterly ripped off. Avoid!
